trial_identification.studytitle: Trial of swine influenza vaccine in healthy adults
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised, controlled, study in healthy adults to evaluate the safety and immunogenicity of an adjuvanted recombinant 2009 H1N1 pandemic swine influenza vaccine

interventions.interventions: Recombinant 2009 H1 haemagglutinin in Advax-adjuvanted vaccine -Subjects will be randomised to receive one of three doses of haemagglutinin ranging from 5, 15 and 45 micrograms
interventions.comparator: Recombinant 2009 H1 haemagglutinin 45 microgram dose without adjuvant will be the control treatment

primaryOutcome.outcome: Seroconversion to 2009 H1N1 as assessed by haemagglutination inhibition assay
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 weeks post first and second vaccination

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Safety as assessed by frequency of vaccine-related and total adverse events
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 weeks post first and second vaccination

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Anti-swine flu T-cell responses as assessed by T-cell recall responses
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: 3 weeks post first and second vaccination

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Vaccine tolerability as assessed by visual analogue pain score
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At time of administration of first and second vaccination

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Flinders Medical Centre Flinders Drive Bedford Park SA 5042

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is the first human study of a novel swine flu vaccine that is designed to identify the optimum dose of vaccine, the optimum number of doses and whether or not an adjuvant is required to provide maximal protection against swine flu

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Flinders medical Centre Flinders Drive Bedford Park SA 5042
